channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UK Lawmakers Vote to Legalize Assisted Dying After Emotional Debate
item.description: In a landmark decision on Friday, Parliament voted in favor of allowing assisted suicide for some terminally ill people under strict conditions.

item.title: FIFA Should Compensate Migrant Workers Injured Building Qatar World Cup, Report Says
item.description: An unpublished report into the soccer governing body’s responsibility for migrant workers recommends that it should compensate those harmed.

item.title: Rebels in Syria Reach Outskirts of Aleppo, in Biggest Advance in Years, Monitor Says
item.description: A war monitor and the rebels said the opposition fighters breached three neighborhoods in Aleppo. The government launched intense airstrikes on rebel ...

item.title: How to watch NFL games on Black Friday 2024 live online for free—and without cable
Four Opinion Writers on ‘Wicked’: ‘Women Deserve Rage. We Have a Lot to Be Angry About.’
item.description: A big-budget holiday film with a strong antifascist message? “Wicked” is not what we expected.

item.title: Glassdoor’s CEO refuses to work in front of his kids, and will head to his home office before he answers calls around them
item.description: “With [my] children, I want to lead by not having digital products all around, or being distracted by my email and text messages all the time," Glassd...

item.title: Russia, Targeting Ukraine’s Grid, Moves to Cut Off Its Nuclear Plants
item.description: Moscow has increasingly hit critical substations linked to nuclear power plants in an effort to disconnect them. The assaults risk a disaster, experts...

item.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE partner Vivek Ramaswamy says they’ll scrutinize $6.6 billion Biden loan to Tesla rival Rivian
item.description: Critics advise the incoming Trump administration to pull the plug on 'corporate-welfare loans handed out for political reasons'.

item.title: How Office Depot’s president builds trust with shoppers in a digital world
item.description: Customers want to talk to another human being who can help solve their problem, says Office Depot and OfficeMax president Kevin Moffitt.
